Replace.Text: Tokisaki Kurumi's special project requires [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time, and the military unit currently located in the city's territory has +1 [ICON_Movement] movement power.
Tokisaki Kurumi's special project, it takes [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time, and the enemy military units currently located in this city's territory have -1 [ICON_Movement] movement power.
Tokisaki Kurumi's special item, it takes [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time, and the military units currently in this city's territory get additional combat experience points.
Tokisaki Kurumi's special item, it takes [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time, and the military units currently in the city's territory can be healed every round.
Emperor Keke: The Bullet of Five
Tokisaki Kurumi's special project, it takes [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time, and the military units currently located in this city's territory have +1 vision.
Emperor Keke: The Bullet of Six
Tokisaki Kurumi's characteristic item, it takes [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time, and the enemy military units currently located in this city's territory have -1 vision.

Tokisaki Kurumi's special project requires [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time, and the movement of other players' current military unit [ICON_Movement] will drop significantly, lasting for three rounds.
Tokisaki Kurumi's special item requires [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time to obtain a Nightmare Shadow that does not consume [ICON_Citizen] population.
Emperor Keke: The Bullet of Nine
Tokisaki Kurumi's special project, it takes [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time to obtain temporary vision of all cities and city-states.
Emperor Keke: The Bullet of Ten

Tokisaki Kurumi's special project, it takes [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time to increase the visibility level of [ICON_VisLimited] objects with the lowest diplomatic visibility by one level. [COLOR_Civ6Red] Refund [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time spent[ENDCOLOR] if diplomatic visibility to all civilizations is at max.

Tokisaki Kurumi's three characteristic items need [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time, and your empire will get [ICON_Science] science value, [ICON_Culture] culture value, [ICON_Gold] gold coin and [ICON_Faith] faith proportional to the city's productivity.

Tokisaki Kurumi's three special items need [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time, and other empires lose the [ICON_Science] science value, [ICON_Culture] culture value, [ICON_Gold] gold coin and [ICON_Faith] belief produced in three rounds.
Gain additional [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength from Nightmare Camp and adjacent Nightmare Shadows.
+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement. Ignores [ICON_Movement] movement cost of terrain and landforms.
Adjacent enemy units -1[ICON_Movement] movement. Only adjacent enemy units can spot this unit.
100% effective when attacking cities and camps from a distance. When killing a unit in combat, all adjacent enemy combat units lose [ICON_Damaged] health.
Gain extra [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time when destroying 1 unit. When attacking a city, there is a chance that it will lose population and gain [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time.
When attacking wounded units, +5 [ICON_Strength] combat strength. When destroying 1 unit, up to 30 HP can be healed.
Block the first non-lethal damage taken each round.
If [ICON_Movement] mobility allows, +1 extra attack per round. Chance to restore [ICON_Movement] movement and attack count when killing a unit in combat.

Tokisaki Kurumi's three special items consume one [ICON_Citizen] population in exchange for [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time, and the loyalty of the city [ICON_Loyalty] decreases slightly. [NEWLINE][COLOR_RED] If the city has only one [ICON_Citizen] population left, it will become a free city. [ENDCOLOR]
